business.headline: Succession Wars: The Hinduja family's bitter battle for controlAt the heart of the Hinduja family's success was their ethos of shared ownership, but this same principle ultimately sparked their multi-billion dollar feud, endangering an empire built on unity.

Boeing to cut 17,000 jobs as losses deepen amid factory strikeThe planemaker will also delay the delivery of its first 777X jet by a year. Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg said that the comapny must shrink its workforce "to align with financial reality".

Fortunes soar: India's richest cross $1 trillion mark amid market rallyForbes' analysis shows that India's 100 richest individuals now have a total net worth of $1.1 trillion, more than doubling their wealth since 2019.

From Trent to Titan: Noel Tata's journey to the top of Tata TrustNoel Tata, born to Naval Tata and Simone Tata, has been a key figure in the Tata Group for many years. He holds several senior positions within the conglomerate.

Nariman Point's revival: Office rents expected to nearly double by 2030The report, titled 'South Mumbai – A Renaissance', attributes this expected surge to ongoing infrastructure improvements and rising demand for premium office space in the area.

Noel Tata on being named Tata Trusts Chairman: Will carry on legacy of Ratan TataNoel Tata was named Tata Trusts Chairman after a board meeting held in Mumbai on October 11, where the decision was unanimously agreed upon by the trustees.
Financial crisis looms in Delhi as extra spending tips city into revenue deficitSeveral departments have underscored additional resource needs, which strain the budget further.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as foreign investment fizzles; Tata Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 230.05 points to close at 81,381.36, while the Nifty50 declined by 34.20 points to end at 24,964.25.
Tata group stocks surge 3% as Noel Tata takes charge at Tata TrustsNoel Tata's appointment came after the death of Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Sons, on October 9 at the age of 86.

Appointed Chairman of Tata Trusts, Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata Noel Tata has been appointed as the new Chairman of Tata Trusts, effective October 11, following the death of his half-brother Ratan Tata on October 9 at the age of 86.

Who is Noel Tata, new Tata Trusts Chairman and half-brother of Ratan TataNoel Tata has made significant contributions to the Tata Group's growth and success. His strategic vision, coupled with his deep understanding of the group's businesses, has enabled him to play a key role in driving innovation and expanding the group's global reach.

Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata, unanimously appointed Chairman of Tata TrustsNoel Tata has been a part of the Tata Group for over 40 years. The appointment was made during a meeting held in Mumbai and was unanimously agreed upon by the board of Tata Trusts.

Mehli Mistry, Noel Tata lead race to become Tata Trusts chairman: ReportNoel Tata is already a trustee in the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust, which together hold a 66% stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group.

Rupee falls to all-time low against dollar amid oil price surgeThe rupee weakened to 83.99 per dollar, slightly surpassing its previous all-time low of 83.9850 recorded on September 12, and down from the 83.9675 level seen in the prior trading session.

Garuda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Online guide to check statusGaruda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Investors who have bid for the IPO can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as financial stocks drag markets; Tata Steel up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex declined 65.89 points to 81,545.52, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 1.35 points to 24,997.10

Gold, silver price today, October 11, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today October 11, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Who will inherit Ratan Tata's legacy in the Tata Group?Ratan Tata, a towering icon of industry and philanthropy who died on Wednesday, leaves behind a significant legacy and an empty chair.

TCS Q2 results: Dividend set at Rs 10 per share. Check key datesTCS Q2 results: The company reported a 5% year-on-year (YoY) rise in net profit, amounting to Rs 11,909 crore, compared to Rs 11,342 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

Ratan Tata was a great human being, very humble: Narayana MurthyIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy paid tribute to late industrialist, Ratan Tata. Murthy lauded Ratan Tata as a 'compassionate human being who transcended financial status and official power.'

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rahul Gandhi to review Congress's preparedness in Maharashtra after Haryana lossCongress MP Rahul Gandhi will meet Congress leaders and review the party's poll preparedness in Maharashtra ahead of the upcoming Assembly polls slated to be held later this year.

Mumbai-New York Air India flight diverted to Delhi after bomb threatThe flight received a bomb threat after taking off from Mumbai airport and was subsequently diverted to Delhi, where an inspection was underway.

Netanyahu considers 'surrender or starve' plan for northern Gaza: ReportThe General's Plan, proposed to Netanyahu and the Israeli parliament, aims to starve out Hamas militants and force them to surrender by cutting off essential supplies to the population in northern Gaza.

President's rule revoked in J&K, paves way for Omar Abdullah's governmentThis comes after National Conference leader Omar Abdullah met with Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Friday to stake claim to form a new government following the recently concluded Assembly polls in J&K.

Can you follow zero-waste living in India?Zero waste living is simply a lifestyle that aims to minimise waste production. It involves making conscious choices to reduce, reuse, and recycle items, and to avoid single-use products.

1 killed in violent clashes during Durga idol immersion in UP, 30 detainedUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Aditynath took note of the communal clashes in the state's Bahraich district and said that the guilty will not be spared. He also directed the local officials to ensure that the immersion of Durga idols is conducted peacefully.

Baba Siddique's murder accused not a minor, bone test revealsA bone ossification test ordered by a Mumbai court revealed that Dharmaraj Kashyap, an accused in the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique who claimed to be a minor, is an adult.

US to send THAAD anti-missile system to Israel to boost defences amid attacksPentagon spokesperson Pat Ryder said the deployment of the Terminal High-Altitude Area Defence (THAAD) battery would augment Israel's integrated air defence system.

SpaceX can re-launch Super Heavy rocket within an hour of its returnThe Super Heavy booster was caught by the launch pad's mechanical arms, affectionately referred to as "chopsticks", just seven minutes after lift-off from Boca Chica, Texas, on Sunday.

Video: McDonald's worker fails to recognise Bill Clinton. What happened nextWhile campaigning for Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris in Georgia, former President Bill Clinton stepped into a McDonald's, only to find the employee at the counter failing to recognise him.

India can still qualify for semis after Australia loss. Here's howWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: India lost to Australia by nine runs in Sharjah on Sunday, but Harmanpreet Kaur's women are still in with a chance of making their way through to the semi-final.
4 Israeli soldiers killed, over 60 injured in Hezbollah drone strikeThe attack, which took place late Sunday, is one of the deadliest incidents since the war began in October last year.

Covid-19: First wave increased heart attack, stroke risk up to three yearsA study backed by the US government has found that unvaccinated people infected with Covid-19 face increased risks of heart attacks, strokes, and death for up to three years, especially during the pandemic's early phase.

Man with guns and fake pass arrested outside Donald Trump's rally in CaliforniaThe suspect, Vem Miller, was carrying a loaded shotgun, a handgun and a high capacity magazine and was arrested moments before Donald Trump's rally in Coachella Valley was scheduled to begin.

Patiala to Mumbai: How Baba Siddique's murder was plottedMohammad Zeeshan Akhtar, who came out of jail on June 7 this year, met Gurmail Singh, one of the accused in the Baba Siddique murder case. While in jail, Akhtar was allegedly given a contract to kill Siddique by members of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, sources said.

Another massive drug bust, cocaine worth Rs 5,000 crore seized in GujaratA joint team of Delhi Police and Gujrat Police raided the premises of Aavkar Drugs Limited Company in Ankleshwar, during which 518 kg of drugs was recovered.

Hina Khan nearing last cycle of chemotherapy, posts pic of 'last standing eyelash'Actor Hina Khan shared her experience of losing eyelashes due to chemotherapy. She remains positive, using her "last standing eyelash" as motivation and wearing 'falsies' for shoots.

Scrap workers, criminal background: All about Baba Siddique murder accusedThe police have arrested Dharmaraj Rajesh Kashyap, Pravin Lonkar and Gurmail Baljit Singh, in connection with the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique.

Watch: SpaceX makes history, successfully catches Super Heavy booster mid-airIn a maneuver never before attempted, the 232-foot-tall Super Heavy booster executed a series of precise burns to align itself with the launch tower.

Trump proposes military action on 'enemy from within' amid assassination bidsAs Donald Trump faces assassination threats, the Republican presidential candidate suggested the possible use of the military to deal with the "enemy from within" on November 5, the day when the presidential election will be held.

Bigg Boss 18: Donkey removed from show after PETA urges makers, Salman Khan Following PETA's plea to remove Donkey, also known as Gadhraj, from Bigg Boss 18, the show's producers complied by eliminating the animal in the most recent episode.

700 shooters, 11 states: How Lawrence Bishnoi is following Dawood's pathThe NIA has filed a chargesheet under the stringent UAPA law against Lawrence Bishnoi and Goldy Brar. In its chargesheet, the NIA compared Lawrence Bishnoi's gang to Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company.
Centre approves new missile testing range in Andhra PradeshThis move is aimed at strengthening the country's defence capabilities, particularly in testing tactical missile systems.
'Big brother' protecting Telangana Congress leaders from ED: KTRKTR pointed out that while Congress and BJP leaders often clash in Delhi, their behaviour in Telangana suggests a hidden alliance.

Bigg Boss Tamil 8 Weekend highlights: Ravindar Chandrasekaran evictedProducer Ravindar Chandrasekaran is the first contestant to be eliminated from Bigg Boss Tamil Season 8. Host Vijay Sethupathi's strict line of questioning forced the contestants to open up and not be diplomatic.

Alia Bhatt shares why Jee Le Zaraa with Priyanka Chopra, Katrina Kaif is delayedJee Le Zaraa, directed by Farhan Akhtar and starring Priyanka Chopra, Katrina Kaif, and Alia Bhatt, faces delays due to scheduling issues. Alia remains optimistic about the film's production.

Ranbir Kapoor turns groom for designer Tarun Tahiliani, fans reactRanbir Kapoor made a striking appearance as a groom at a recent fashion show in Delhi. His stunning attire quickly went viral, earning him widespread admiration from fans.

Bigg Boss 18: Donkey removed from show after PETA urges makers, Salman Khan Following PETA's plea to remove Donkey, also known as Gadhraj, from Bigg Boss 18, the show's producers complied by eliminating the animal in the most recent episode.

New AI scam targets Gmail users with fake account recovery requestsA sophisticated AI scam targeting Gmail users has emerged, tricking individuals into approving fake account recovery requests to steal personal data. IT consultant Sam Mitrovic shares his encounter with this scam, detailing the deceptive tactics used to gain access to users' information.

Apple might introduce Meta-like smart glasses and AirPods with camera in 2027After AirPods 4, Apple is eyeing to release AirPods with cameras into the market. According to Bloomberg's Mark German, the company plans to launch them in 2027.

Apple iPhone 15 is now available for with Rs 27,000 discount, but only for limited time Apple is offering significant discounts on iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Plus. With offers extending up to Rs 27,000 off.

Elon Musk's Tesla humanoid Optimus reveals hardest part of being a robotElon Musk unveiled the latest generation of Tesla's humanoid Optimus at the We, Robot event. While according to Musk, the robots can now do anything, Optimus reveals that the hardest part of being a robot is learning how to be human. Read on.

sports.headline: UEFA Nations League: England return to winning ways with 3-1 Finland winEngland bounced back from their loss against Greece with a convincing 3-1 win over Finland in the UEFA Nations League on October 13, Sunday. The Three Lions won the match 3-1 to get their campaign back on track.

Pat Cummins returns as captain as Australia announce ODI squad vs PakistanAustralia Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins return after his break as the world champions named their ODI squad against Pakistan. Australia will take on Pakistan in a 3-match ODI series.

Wish Pakistan all the best against New Zealand: India coach Amol MuzumdarIndia coach Amol Muzumdar sent his best wishes to Pakistan ahead of their clash against New Zealand on Monday, October 14. Cricket Australia confirmed the news on October 14, Monday with Green set to undergo surgery and be on the shelf for 6 months.

Yamal leaves Spain camp for Barcelona despite being cleared of injuryLamine Yamal has been released from Spain's national team camp as a precaution after suffering minor discomfort during the Nations League match against Denmark, although medical tests confirmed no significant injury.

Why was Phoebe Litchfield not given out LBW vs India? Explained   Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Phoebe Litchfield wasn't given LBW by the third umpire despite her trying to play a switch hit and changing her stance in the match against India.

Sabalenka makes history with Wuhan Open title after beating Zheng Wuhan Open 2024: Aryna Sabalenka claimed the title for the third year in a row after beating China's Qinwen Zheng 6-3, 5-7, 6-3 in the final on Sunday, October 13.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.
